general.name: spCFrame
general.description: The spCFrame files contain the flux-calibrated extracted spectra for a single CCD (i.e., the red or blue half) of a single exposure. These spectra are still in the native wavelength mapping, which is neither linear in wavelength nor log-wavelength. However, the spectra are flux-calibrated, and deviant pixels are rejected in the pixel mask (from the comparison with the other exposures).

surveys.name: BHM
surveys.description: An optical time-domain spectroscopic survey of quasars and X-ray sources

surveys.name: eBOSS
surveys.description: A cosmological survey of quasars and galaxies to understand baryon acoustic oscillations

changelog.description: Describes changes to the datamodel product and/or file structure from one release to another

hdu1.name: IVAR
hdu1.description: Contains the estimated inverse variance (i.e., the inverse of the square of the estimated error) of the flux density of each spectrum, in units of (10^-17 erg/s/cm^2/Ang)^-2.  It is set to zero (i.e., infinite error) for pixels with flags indicating that the data are unreliable.
